recipes.name: Tortilla Soup
recipes.description: This might just be our favorite soup of all time. A one-pot dish, super quick to make, no frying, just a bit of boiling, and the flexibility of the dish is on par with fried rice! You could put pretty much anything into the soup, and you can also choose any BBQ sauce of your liking or make one yourself with just 4 ingredients. Also, it's freakishly delicious and addictive.

flex.substitutes: We can use any kind of beans, veggies, and toppings for this soup, the world is your corn cob.
If we want to make our own, we can do it with 4 parts ketchup, 1 part vinegar, 1 part sugar, a dash of liquid smoke, or whatever other BBQ sauce recipe we have.
Not necessary, but always a wonderful flavor enhancer.
Are interchangeable with any chips of our liking. It's just a bit awkward to call it tortilla soup if we're using Maui Onion Chips.

instructions: 1. Add the water and pureed tomatoes to a pot and put the heat to medium high.
2. Then add corn, jackfruit, beans (along with all the aquafaba), oregano, white pepper, vegetable bouillon, and BBQ sauce. Bring to a simmer.
3. When the soup reach a simmer, taste and decide if you want to add more vegetable stock, oregano, white pepper, or BBQ sauce.
4. Serve with chopped avocado, chopped red onion, and tortilla chips as toppings.
recipes.notes: Any veggies can be used in this soup. The flavor comes mainly from the vegetable bouillon, the pureed tomatoes, the BBQ sauce, as well as the white pepper and oregano. The toppings are whatever we want them to be. The BBQ sauce is a free choice too... but we like the smoky ones the best for this soup! When tasting the soup before serving, remember that we want it to be salty, sweet, smoky, tangy, and spicy.

recipes.name: Garlicky Noodles
recipes.description: These garlic noodles are so incredibly quick, easy, and tasty, combining a few Western and Asian ingredients to make one very flavorful bowl of deliciousness.

flex.substitutes: Use any noodles you likey, thin or thick, round or flat. Yes, that includes Italian pasta too.
Use refined white sugar, brown sugar, palm sugar, or our favorite... Muscovado sugar!
Not necessary, but always a wonderful flavor enhancer.
Or why not fresh chopped up chili if you have it.
Most vinegars are fairly identical substitutes, e.g. white wine vinegar, apple cider vinegar, etc.

instructions: 1. Bring a pot or pan of water to a boil, then salt the water to your liking and add the noodles.
3. Add butter to a wok or pan on medium high heat and fry for 1 minute.
4. Add soy, sugar, chili flakes, chopped spring onion, MSG, and vinegar. Set the heat to low until the noodles are done.
5. Add noodles to the sauce, set the heat to high and mix for 1 minute. Serve.
recipes.notes: MSG is amazing in this dish.

recipes.name: Mango Ceviche
recipes.description: This ceviche goes excellently with something salty and savory like Bulgogi spring rolls.

flex.substitutes: Lemon or yuzu works just as well.

instructions: 1. Chop up all the ingredients and add to a bowl.
2. Squeeze a lime into the bowl. Serve.
recipes.notes: If you have an extra ingredient you want to add to the ceviche, it will probably fit well.

recipes.name: Habibi Burgers
recipes.description: Plant-based meat, plant-based cheese, veggies, buns, and three different saucy elements in between. This is our absolute favorite burger.

flex.substitutes: We can also use something like beans or lentils to make veggie patties.
Any oil works just as well.
Flavored mayo is scrumptios too. Our favorite in these burgers is truffle mayo.
Any BBQ sauce works, or even just ketchup. Sometimes we mix ketchup with a hot sauce and use that mix instead.

instructions: 1. Heat a pan on medium high heat with butter/oil. Season the patties with salt and white pepper. When hot, start frying the burger patties for a couple minutes on each side. Add cheese slices on top immediately after the first flip.
2. Slice tomato, onion, and rip some lettuce for all burgers.
recipes.notes: Lots of things can be added to the burger. Sliced avocado for example. You can also caramelize the onions instead of adding them raw. Also, if you want the buns warm and a bit roasted, like we do, try putting them into an oven in 400°F for 4 minutes, or into a toaster, or fry them in the burger pan for a minute each.
